Lack enough support: The expert's verdict mentions that the exact origins of the photograph are unclear and that they have not been able to contact the photographer to verify details about when and where it was taken. The lack of concrete evidence and information supports the bias of lacking enough support.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the photograph shows a racist sign displayed on a farm in southern Illinois. This indicates a problematic assumption in the claim.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict presents alternative explanations by stating that the origins of the photograph are unclear and that there is no confirmation of the sign being displayed at Rollman Farms. This suggests the existence of alternative explanations to the claim.
Falters at times: The expert's verdict mentions that local police officers and an unofficial community page have not been able to verify the authenticity of the sign. This indicates that the claim falters at times in terms of providing concrete evidence or confirmation.
Understate: The expert's verdict does not mention any instances of understating in relation to the claim.
